item.title: Wound, Therapy & Vigilance in Sophia Naz’s Poetry
item.description: Very early in Sophia Naz’s _Poin_tillism we encounter the poem “Chappan Churri”, about one Janaki Bai who was stabbed fifty-six (chappan, in Urdu/Hindu) times by a jilted lover, but survived.
